title: Bibliographic Records Control Instruction Letter (IIC-C820-11) | Yönerge
text: Instruction No IIC-C820-11-V06 Effective Date 20-04-2012 Update Date 07-05-2024 Related Unit / Owner IC / Bilgi Merkezi Direktörlüğü Approved by BT / Board of Trustees Aim To audit and make available the records of information resources that constitute the Sabancı University Information Center collections in accordance with international standards. Scope Covering the steps in the process, from controlling the bibliographic records of information resources whose acquisition processes have been completed to making the records available to users. Principle To control bibliographic records in accordance with international rules and create quality records that other institutions can benefit from. Statutory Basis Definitions / Abbreviations AAKK2 (Anglo American Cataloging Rules 2): A set of rules for cataloging information resources prepared by the Library of Congress to ensure consistency in cataloging practices across institutions and to guide catalogers. Library of Congress Subject Headings: A list of headings created by the Library of Congress to define the subject matter of an information resource and ensure consistency. Barcode Number: A numbering system designed to identify the fixed asset numbers of information resources and also used during inventorying and loaning processes. Bibliographic Record: Identification information consisting of the title of a publication, responsibility (author, editor, translator, etc.), edition, publisher, distributor, publication date, standard number (ISBN/ISSN, etc.), and physical characteristics that bibliographically define it. Call Tracking System: This system is used to perform work related to processes in the Information Center, particularly in the execution, monitoring, control, and completion of inter-departmental work. Docserver: A shared storage area provided by the Information Technology Unit for the use of other units, accessible by authorized employees, and accessed via the network. ISBN (International Standard Book Number): A 10- and/or 13-digit international numbering system assigned to each book that identifies the publication. ISSN (International Standard Periodical Number): An 8-digit international numbering system assigned to each published periodical that identifies the periodical. MARC21: The computerized format of AAKK2/RDA, also known as the "Machine-Readable Catalog." Authority Index: A record created and kept up-to-date using the author/institution name, subject heading, and series name to ensure uniformity of bibliographic record entry elements. RDA (Resource Description and Access): A new set of rules developed specifically for cataloging and accessing digital and other information resources, based on AAKK2. System: The cataloging module of the software used in Information Center services. Regulations 1 . The following elements of bibliographic records are continuously monitored and updated: Title Author/Institution Name Series Name Subject Heading ISBN/ISSN Number Barcode Number MARC21 Fields Call Number System Headings Table of Contents Link Information 2. The following elements of authority records are continuously monitored and updated: Author/Institution Name Series Name Subject Heading 3. The author/institution and series names are monitored and updated according to the "AAKK2/RDA" rules. 4. All fields of bibliographic records are monitored and updated in accordance with the "MARC21" format. 5. Subject headings are monitored and updated according to the "Library of Congress Subject Headings" system list. 6. Tools and equipment to ensure the monitoring of bibliographic records are searched, obtained, monitored, and utilized. 7. Filing: 7.1. Correspondence is conducted and stored via generic email address. Correspondence is transferred to a CD annually, and a copy is forwarded to the Information Center archive. 7.2. Incoming documents are filed and stored in accordance with the "Correspondence Management Instruction Letter (IGS-S1010-01)." 7.3. Forms are listed, filed, and stored in accordance with the "Record Control Instruction Letter (IGS-S620-05)" 7.4. Work is conducted through the Call Tracking System, and correspondence is stored there. 8. Reporting: 8.1. Activities and statistics are uploaded to Docserver on a monthly/annual basis and reported to the Management. 8.2. Improvements/updates and requests received from users and/or identified during the work performed are added to the "Corrective Action Form (FGS-S620-03-01)" and reported to the Management.
